required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Remote Ischemic Preconditioning on Cardiac Function After Endurance Exercise

oversight_info.authority: Netherlands: The Central Committee on Research Involving Human Subjects (CCMO)

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate the effect of remote ischemic preconditioning on biochemical and functional indices of cardiac function induced by a 30 km run in healthy trained long distance runners.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Basic Science

secondary_outcome.measure: Indices of cardiac function measured by echocardiography

arm_group.description: Control treatment (sham RIC) will consist of four 5-minute simulated inflations of a blood pressure cuff placed on the upper arm. The inflations will be separated by 5-minute periods when the blood pressure cuff will be deflated.
Blood pressure cuff placed on upper arm and inflated to 200mmHg for 5 minutes then deflated for 5 minutes - this cycle is repeated a total of 4 times.

intervention.description: Blood pressure cuff placed on upper arm and inflated to 200mmHg for 5 minutes then deflated for 5 minutes - this cycle is repeated a total of 4 times.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed consent
- Healthy
- Age between 18 and 65 years
- Endurance-trained (two or more training sessions per week)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not applicable

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Clinical Chemistry, MUMC, Maastricht, the Netherlands
